component.text:
Activity – Evaluating Extended ACL Statements

Click Buttons 2, 3, and 4 to complete the activity. Click Button 1 to review the topology at any time.

Activity – Evaluating Extended ACL Statements

Scenario 1 – Refer to the topology in the first figure. This scenario provides the extended ACL 103 and the source and destination combinations in the table. Based on this information, determine whether packets will be permitted or denied. Drag Permit or Deny to the field next to each source and destination combination. Click Button 3 to continue.
You have successfully ordered the ACL configuration commands. Click Button 3 to continue.
You have not successfully ordered the ACL configuration commands. Please click Reset to again.

Activity – Evaluating Extended ACL Statements

Scenario 2 – Refer to the topology in the first figure. This scenario provides the extended ACL 104 and the source and destination combinations in the table. Based on this information, determine whether packets will be permitted or denied. Drag Permit or Deny to the field next to each source and destination combination. Click Button 4 to continue.
You have successfully ordered the ACL configuration commands. Click Button 4 to continue.
You have not successfully ordered the ACL configuration commands. Please click Reset to again.

Activity – Evaluating Extended ACL Statements

Scenario 3 – Refer to the topology in the first figure.This scenario provides the extended ACL 105 and the source and destination combinations in the table. Based on this information, determine whether packets will be permitted or denied. Place a checkmark in the appropriate Permit or Deny column on the table.
You have successfully ordered the ACL configuration commands.
You have not successfully ordered the ACL configuration commands. Please click Reset to again.
